dublinCore.dc:title: 119 S2350 IS: Protect DREAMer Confidentiality Act of 2025
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Heinrich (for himself, Mr. Schatz, Mr. Fetterman, Mr. Whitehouse, Mr. Luján, Mrs. Murray, Ms. Hirono, Ms. Cortez Masto, Mr. Sanders, Ms. Duckworth, Mr. Markey, Ms. Rosen, Mr. Bennet, Ms. Warren, Mr. Van Hollen, Mr. Wyden, Mr. Kim, Mr. Blumenthal, Mr. Welch, Ms. Klobuchar, Ms. Blunt Rochester, Mr. King, Mr. Reed, Mr. Padilla, and Mr. Murphy) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To provide for the confidentiality of information submitted in requests for deferred action under the deferred action for childhood arrivals program, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Protect DREAMer Confidentiality Act of 2025.

paragraph.text: The term DACA program means the deferred action for childhood arrivals program described in—

subparagraph.text: subpart C of part 236 of title 8, Code of Federal Regulations;
the final rule of the Department of Homeland Security entitled Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals (87 Fed. Reg. 53152 (August 30, 2022)); or
the memorandum of the Department of Homeland Security entitled Exercising Prosecutorial Discretion with Respect to Individuals Who Came to the United States as Children issued on June 15, 2012.

paragraph.text: The term individual application information means any information, including personally identifiable information, submitted to the Secretary after June 15, 2012, as part of a request for consideration or reconsideration for the DACA program.
The term Secretary means the Secretary of Homeland Security.

section.header: Confidentiality of information submitted for DACA program

subsection.text: The Secretary shall protect individual application information from disclosure to U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement or U.S. Customs and Border Protection or any State, local, or Tribal law enforcement agency for any purpose other than the implementation of the DACA program.

The Secretary may not refer to U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement, U.S. Customs and Border Protection, the Department of Justice, or any other law enforcement agency any individual the case of whom has been deferred pursuant to the DACA program.
Individual application information may be shared with national security and law enforcement agencies—

paragraph.text: to identify or prevent fraudulent claims;
for particularized national security purposes relating to an individual application; and
for the investigation or prosecution of any felony not related to immigration status.
